doc.previous: These recordings were discovered in the Edison Library in New Jersey in the 1950s.[10]
doc.after: There have been at least six films titled The Lost Chord, as well as one titled The Trail of the Lost Chord.[12] In the 1999 film Topsy-Turvy, a scene depicts Fanny Ronalds (played by Eleanor David) facetiously introducing it as "a new composition" at an 1884 party at her house; she then sings it with Sullivan (Allan Corduner) at the piano and Walter Simmonds (Matthew Mills) at the harmonium.[5]
